summary: This is an email from Chris Dilorio forwarding a formal appeal regarding a denied whistleblower award (2015-016). The email contains extensive allegations of SEC corruption, obstruction, and facilitation of fraud, linking various individuals and entities to money laundering schemes, particularly involving shell companies like Riot Blockchain (fka Bioptix) and International Land Alliance. It references multiple ongoing investigations and judicial proceedings.

persons.name: Chris Dilorio
persons.context: Author of the email, making extensive allegations of SEC corruption and obstruction related to his denied whistleblower award and various financial frauds.

persons.name: Mr. Gottschall
persons.context: Addressed in the email, accused by Dilorio of being 'grossly corrupt' and challenged to examine evidence of SEC obstruction.

persons.name: Paul Hoecker
persons.context: Accused by Dilorio of criminal obstruction regarding a 2015 complaint filed with his office after a whistleblower award denial.

persons.name: Barry Honig
persons.context: Named as part of the Honig/Stetson group involved in alleged money laundering shells like Bioptix/Riot Blockchain. Also noted as a Trump fundraiser.

persons.name: Michael Stetson
persons.context: Named alongside Barry Honig in the alleged Bioptix/Riot Blockchain money laundering scheme and referenced in an SEC complaint.

persons.name: John Jaclin
persons.context: Linked to Honig/Stetson and mentioned in the context of money laundering shells left running by the SEC.

persons.name: Mark Farkas
persons.context: Mentioned in the same context as Jaclin regarding alleged fraudulent schemes.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Accused of criminally obstructing a thorough investigation of Hapoalim tax evasion and money laundering while at the SDNY. Also noted as being in possession of information regarding the Dan Kamensky case.

persons.name: Scott Shay
persons.context: Noted as Chairman of Signature Bank (SBNY), which served as escrow agent for the Bioptix offering and is linked to Hapoalim. Also on the board of CardWorks.

persons.name: Ivanka Trump
persons.context: Mentioned as a former board member of Signature Bank (SBNY), described as a 'go to lender' for Trump/Kushner.

persons.name: Dmitry Akhanov
persons.context: Identified as a Bioptix/Alphasniffer insider and head of the Russian Federal Energy Agency, raising questions about his involvement.

persons.name: Dan Kamensky
persons.context: Subject of a sentencing by Judge Cote which the email author calls a 'gross miscarriage of justice,' alleging he was set up by Handler/Ressler.

persons.name: Judge Cote
persons.context: The judge who sentenced Dan Kamensky. The email argues she should have declared a mistrial.

persons.name: Handler
persons.context: Alleged to have a corrupt relationship with the SEC and to have set up Dan Kamensky to protect an Ares Management deal.

persons.name: Ressler
persons.context: Co-founder of Ares Management, linked to Drexel with Handler, and alleged to have been involved in setting up Dan Kamensky.

persons.name: Sean McKessy
persons.role: Former Chief of SEC Office of the Whistleblower
persons.context: Accused, along with Norberg and Hoecker, of criminal obstruction leading to UBS cross-border business continuing.

persons.name: Michele Norberg
persons.context: Accused of invoking the 'illegally enacted Summary Disposition Rule' in denying a whistleblower award related to UBS AML.

persons.name: Mr. Searles
persons.context: SEC LA official accused of protecting UBS San Diego and allowing multiple frauds to continue.

persons.name: Banerjee
persons.context: SEC LA official mentioned alongside Searles in the context of allowing frauds to continue.

persons.name: Jason Sunstein
persons.context: Identified as a San Diego resident and CFO of several OTC-traded money laundering shells, suggested to be known to SEC LA officials.

persons.name: Ashraf Rofail
persons.context: Named as the CEO of Santeon Group, one of the companies alleged to be a money laundering shell.

persons.name: Joshua Sason
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of 'ongoing' investigations of massive fraud related to the author's claims and linked to AQR and MI Acquisition.

persons.name: Tom Priore
persons.context: Described as a 'known felon' involved with Joshua Sason in MI Acquisition.

persons.name: Chad Readler
persons.context: Former prosecutor on the 'Colleran massive healthcare fraud' case, later appointed as a federal judge by Trump.

connections.description: Frequently paired as 'Honig/Stetson' in allegations of running money laundering shells like Bioptix (later Riot Blockchain).
Linked in the context of alleged money laundering schemes and SEC complaints.
Implied connection through Signature Bank (SBNY), where Strauss allegedly obstructed an investigation involving Hapoalim, and Shay is Chairman.
Linked through Drexel and alleged collusion in setting up Dan Kamensky to protect an Ares Management (Ressler) deal involving Neiman Marcus.
Accused together of 'criminal obstruction' in handling the UBS whistleblower complaint.
Implied that SEC LA official Searles is aware of and protects the activities of Sunstein, a CFO of alleged shell companies.
Dilorio directly addresses and accuses Gottschall (an SEC official) of gross corruption and challenges him to examine evidence.

events.title: Email Forwarding Formal Appeal
events.description: Chris Dilorio forwards an email containing a formal appeal regarding the denial of covered action 2015-016 (Knight Capital TCR).

events.title: Whistleblower Award Denial & Complaint
events.description: Chris Dilorio received a denial for a whistleblower award and subsequently filed a complaint with SEC IG Hoecker's office.

events.title: Ares Management Purchases Neiman Marcus
events.description: Ares Management, led by Ressler, purchased Neiman Marcus. This deal is central to the allegation that Dan Kamensky was set up.

events.title: Sentencing of Dan Kamensky
events.description: Judge Cote sentenced Dan Kamensky. The email author argues this was a miscarriage of justice, alleging Kamensky was set up by Handler/Ressler.

events.title: DOJ Drops DPA with UBS
events.description: The Department of Justice dropped its Deferred Prosecution Agreement with UBS, under terms that allegedly required the cross-border business to be shut downâ€”which the author claims never happened.

keyFacts: The author, Chris Dilorio, is a whistleblower alleging systematic SEC corruption and obstruction in handling his award claims and investigating financial frauds.

Multiple shell companies, including Riot Blockchain (fka Bioptix) and International Land Alliance, are alleged to be vehicles for money laundering, with ties to individuals like Barry Honig and Michael Stetson.
Signature Bank (SBNY) is implicated as an escrow agent for alleged fraudulent offerings and linked to Hapoalim, with former board member Ivanka Trump mentioned.
The sentencing of Dan Kamensky is characterized as a gross miscarriage of justice, allegedly orchestrated by financial figures (Handler/Ressler) to protect an Ares Management investment.
SEC officials in Los Angeles (Searles, Banerjee) are accused of protecting UBS San Diego and allowing multiple OTC shell company frauds to continue operating.
